verse.name: v1
verse.lines: As I went out one morning, morning so fair, I met a lovely maiden with flaxen hair. I'm going to see her Sunday, my love to declare And win unnumbered kisses from lips so rare.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Jíai fait une mai tresse, ya pas long temps, Jíairai la voir di Manche sans plus tarder, Je pren drai sur sa bouche un doux baiser.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: (She) Young man, before you kiss me, try as you will, Young man, before you kiss me, try as you will, I shall become a wild doe and run up the hill, Because I do not like you and never will.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: (He) If you become a doe and flee 'cross the plain, If you become a doe and flee 'cross the plain, Then I'll become a hunter, and fetch you back again, For parted from your sweetness I'll not remain.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: (She) If you become a hunter, I'll rove about. If you become a hunter, I'll rove about. I'll jump into the river and then be a trout, And down among the rocks I'll swim in and out.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: (He) If you become a trout, an angler I'll be, If you become a trout, an angler I'll be, I'll cast my line and catch you where stream meets the sea, For no one else shall have you, no one but me.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: (She) If you become an angler, casting my way, If you become an angler, casting my way, Then I'll become a rose and in my garden stay, Because my answer to you shall ev'r be nay.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: (He) If you become a rosebud, glist'ning with dew, If you become a rosebud, glist'ning with dew, Then I'll become a gard'ner and when I find you, I'll let no one come near, 'till to me you're true.

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: (She) If you become a gard'ner, I'll not undone, If you become a gard'ner, I'll not undone, I'll climb right ov'r the convent wall and then be a nun, For I will grant no favors to you, not one.

verse.name: v9
verse.lines: (He) If you become a nun, behind cloistered walls, If you become a nun, behind cloistered walls, Then I'll become the doctor who on the cloister calls, For I shall never lose you, what ev'r befalls.

verse.name: v10
verse.lines: (She) If you become the doctor, then I shall die, If you become the doctor, then I shall die, I'll ask the Lord to take me to my home on high, And then to you at last I'll have said, "Goodbye."

verse.name: v11
verse.lines: (He) If you go up to heaven, I'll race you there, If you go up to heaven, I'll race you there, I shall become St. Peter, your home to prepare, And, for eternity, we, the bliss, will share.

verse.name: v12
verse.lines: (She) Oh, if you are St. Peter, with golden key, Oh, if you are St. Peter, with golden key Then I'll come down to earth again and say, "Marry me." For I have never seen such persistency.
